description: ERECTION OF SINGLE STOREY REAR EXTENSION, OUTBUILDING IN REAR GARDEN, HIP TO GABLE AND REAR ROOF DORMER EXTENSION AND INTERNAL ALTERATIONS
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Site location plan and drawings SMA/205/100, SMA/205/101, SMA/205/110 & SMA/205/111

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the windows in the hip to gable elevation shall be obscure glazed and fixed shut to a height on 1.7m above relative floor level glazed with obscure glass and fixed shut and shall permanently maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 5 - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 6 - No demolition or construction work or ancillary activities such as deliveries shall take place before 8am or after 6pm Mondays - Fridays inclusive, before 8am or after 1pm on Saturdays or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 7 - The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied at any time other than for purposes incidental to the residential use of the dwelling known as 67 Maycross Avenue
Reason; To safeguard the amenities of neighbouring residents, to prevent the unauthorised introduction of an independent use and to ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy D3 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS14 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policy DM D2 of Merton's Sites and Polices Plan 2014.

Condition : 8 - The applicant should be aware that the site may provide a useful habitat for swifts. Swifts are currently in decline in the UK and in order to encourage and improve the conservation of swifts the applicant is advised to consider the installation of a swift nesting box/bricks on the site.

Condition : 9 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required other than to confirm site boundaries.
